title: Innovative Online Ophthalmology Education Design: Effective Learning Strategies Within Limited Time

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic medical terminology and physiological understanding
context.additional_context: Need to establish a smartphone-based learning environment and formative assessment-centered feedback system

learning_goals: Learners will identify key symptoms and diagnostic criteria of ophthalmic diseases with 80% accuracy.
Learners will perform basic ophthalmic examination procedures (visual acuity tests, fundus examinations, etc.) using smartphone-compatible virtual simulation tools.
Learners will apply a three-step thinking process (symptom-diagnosis-treatment plan) after analyzing real clinical cases.
Learners will periodically review and supplement their learning content through weekly quizzes and peer assessment activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
